title: Changelog
text: notable changes LearnStatsVis package documented file.

title: Changelog
text: Initial release LearnStatsVis package Interactive visualization P-values hypothesis testing biological examples Interactive visualization t-tests comparing two biological groups Interactive visualization ANOVA comparing multiple treatment conditions Interactive visualization confidence intervals biological parameter estimation Interactive visualization statistical power analysis biological experiments Main application interface access visualizations Comprehensive documentation vignettes Test suite package functions Example scripts tutorials Makefile package development tasks

title: Changelog
text: P-value visualization using differential gene expression examples T-test visualization comparing gene expression conditions ANOVA visualization comparing gene expression across multiple treatments Confidence interval visualization estimating biological parameters Power analysis visualization designing biological experiments User-friendly interface real-time parameter adjustments Biological interpretations statistical results Export capabilities visualizations (future versions)

title: Changelog
text: README.md installation usage instructions Vignette detailed tutorial using package Function documentation applications Example scripts quick start Project summary documentation

title: Changelog
text: Add visualization Chi-square tests Include Wilcoxon Ranksum test comparison Add regression analysis visualization Implement effect size visualization tools Add multiple testing correction visualizations

title: Changelog
text: Expand cover statistical concepts listed project requirements Add biological examples case studies Implement export features publications Add collaborative sharing capabilities Include additional probability distributions Add Bayesian statistics visualizations

title: GitHub Actions Deployment Setup
text: document explains set GitHub Actions workflows deploy LearnStatsVis package documentation GitHub Pages Shiny app shinyapps.io.

title: GitHub Actions Deployment Setup
text: GitHub repository must GitHub Pages enabled pkgdown workflow automatically generate deploy documentation

title: GitHub Actions Deployment Setup
text: Account shinyapps.io Application created shinyapps.io dashboard API token secret shinyapps.io

title: GitHub Actions Deployment Setup
text: Go GitHub repository settings > Secrets variables > Actions add secrets:

title: GitHub Actions Deployment Setup
text: SHINYAPPS_ACCOUNT_NAME: shinyapps.io account name SHINYAPPS_TOKEN: shinyapps.io API token SHINYAPPS_SECRET: shinyapps.io API secret SHINYAPPS_APP_NAME: Name application shinyapps.io

title: GitHub Actions Deployment Setup
text: Deploys package documentation GitHub Pages automatically every push main branch. Triggers: - Push main branch - Pull requests main branch : - Sets R environment - Installs required packages - Generates documentation using pkgdown - Deploys GitHub Pages

title: GitHub Actions Deployment Setup
text: Deploys Shiny app shinyapps.io automatically every push main branch releases. Triggers: - Push main branch - Release published : - Sets R environment - Installs required packages including rsconnect - Configures rsconnect shinyapps.io credentials - Creates sample Shiny app demonstrates package functionality - Deploys shinyapps.io

title: GitHub Actions Deployment Setup
text: Go GitHub repository Navigate Settings > Pages “Source”, select “GitHub Actions” Save settings

title: GitHub Actions Deployment Setup
text: Create account shinyapps.io Log dashboard create new application Go Account > Tokens generate API token secret Add required secrets GitHub repository described

title: GitHub Actions Deployment Setup
text: workflows located .github/workflows/ workflows automatically run push main branch Check Actions tab repository monitor workflow execution

title: GitHub Actions Deployment Setup
text: GitHub Actions workflows expect following structure:
code: LearnStatsVis/ ├── .github/ │   └── workflows/ │       ├── pkgdown.yaml      # For documentation deployment │       └── shinyapps.yaml    # For Shiny app deployment ├── R/                       # R source files ├── man/                     # Documentation ├── DESCRIPTION             # Package metadata ├── NAMESPACE              # Exported functions ├── pkgdown/               # pkgdown configuration └── _pkgdown.yml           # pkgdown configuration file

title: GitHub Actions Deployment Setup
text: make documentation look better, create _pkgdown.yml file:
code: title: LearnStatsVis url: https://your-username.github.io/LearnStatsVis  template:   bootstrap: 5   bootswatch: flatly  home:   title: Learn Statistics by Visualization   description: Interactive visualizations for learning statistics concepts with biological examples  navbar:   title: "LearnStatsVis"   left:     - text: "Home"       href: index.html     - text: "Functions"       href: reference/index.html     - text: "Articles"       href: articles/index.html     - text: "News"       href: news/index.html   right:     - icon: fa-github       href: https://github.com/your-username/LearnStatsVis

title: GitHub Actions Deployment Setup
text: deployment, can test workflows locally using act tool: Install act: brew install act (macOS) check GitHub OS options Run: act -j documentation test pkgdown workflow Run: act -j deploy test shinyapps workflow

title: GitHub Actions Deployment Setup
text: Documentation deploying: Make sure GitHub Pages enabled repository settings Deployment shinyapps.io failing: Verify secrets correctly set Package dependencies installing: Check required packages listed DESCRIPTION file

title: GitHub Actions Deployment Setup
text: Check logs Actions tab GitHub repository troubleshoot issues workflows.

title: GitHub Actions Deployment Setup
text: Never commit API tokens secrets directly codebase Use GitHub Secrets sensitive information Review access permissions repository carefully

title: GitHub Actions Deployment Setup
text: Push changes main branch trigger new deployments Documentation update automatically push Shiny app redeploy push main new release published

what: LearnStatsVis: Interactive Visualizations for Learning Statistics Concepts
title: Introduction to LearnStatsVis
text: LearnStatsVis package provides functions create sample data, perform statistical tests, generate visualizations learning statistics concepts biological examples. also includes Shiny app interactive exploration.

previous_headings: LearnStatsVis: Interactive Visualizations for Learning Statistics Concepts
title: Introduction to LearnStatsVis
text: package separates computational visualization components interactive interface: R functions perform statistical computations generate visualizations Shiny app shiny/ directory provides interactive interface structure allows programmatic use interactive exploration

previous_headings: LearnStatsVis: Interactive Visualizations for Learning Statistics Concepts > Basic Usage
title: Introduction to LearnStatsVis
code: # Generate data for P-value visualization pvalue_data <- generate_pvalue_data(   n = 30,    mean_true = 0.5,    mean_null = 0,    sd = 1 )  # Create the visualization pvalue_plot <- create_pvalue_plot(pvalue_data, mean_null = 0) plot(pvalue_plot)

previous_headings: LearnStatsVis: Interactive Visualizations for Learning Statistics Concepts > Basic Usage
title: Introduction to LearnStatsVis
code: # Generate data for t-test visualization ttest_data <- generate_ttest_data(   n1 = 15,    n2 = 15,    mean1 = 0,    mean2 = 0.5 )  # Create the visualization ttest_plot <- create_ttest_plot(ttest_data) plot(ttest_plot)

previous_headings: LearnStatsVis: Interactive Visualizations for Learning Statistics Concepts > Basic Usage
title: Introduction to LearnStatsVis
code: # Generate data for ANOVA visualization anova_data <- generate_anova_data(   n1 = 10,    n2 = 10,    n3 = 10,    mean1 = 0,    mean2 = 0.5,    mean3 = 1 )  # Create the visualization anova_plot <- create_anova_plot(anova_data) plot(anova_plot)

previous_headings: LearnStatsVis: Interactive Visualizations for Learning Statistics Concepts
title: Introduction to LearnStatsVis
text: run interactive Shiny application: Shiny app allows : - Select different statistical concepts explore - Adjust parameters real-time - See immediate visual feedback - Access biological interpretations results
code: # From the package directory shiny::runApp("shiny/")

previous_headings: LearnStatsVis: Interactive Visualizations for Learning Statistics Concepts > Available Function Categories
title: Introduction to LearnStatsVis
text: functions generate sample data different statistical scenarios: - generate_pvalue_data() - hypothesis testing - generate_ttest_data() - comparing two groups - generate_anova_data() - comparing multiple groups - generate_ci_data() - confidence interval exploration - generate_power_data() - power analysis - generate_chisq_data() - chi-square tests - generate_wilcox_data() - Wilcoxon tests - generate_regression_data() - regression analysis

previous_headings: LearnStatsVis: Interactive Visualizations for Learning Statistics Concepts > Available Function Categories
title: Introduction to LearnStatsVis
text: functions create ggplot visualizations: - create_pvalue_plot() - Visualizes P-value concepts - create_ttest_plot() - Visualizes t-test results - create_anova_plot() - Visualizes ANOVA results - create_ci_plot() - Visualizes confidence intervals - create_power_plot() - Visualizes power analysis - create_chisq_plot() - Visualizes chi-square tests - create_wilcox_plot() - Visualizes Wilcoxon tests - create_regression_plot() - Visualizes regression relationships - create_residuals_plot() - Visualizes regression residuals

previous_headings: LearnStatsVis: Interactive Visualizations for Learning Statistics Concepts
title: Introduction to LearnStatsVis
text: examples package use biological contexts : - Gene expression comparisons conditions - Drug treatment effects biological pathways - Population biology ecological statistics - Experimental design considerations makes statistical concepts accessible relevant life scientists.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Zhenguo Zhang. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Zhang Z (2025). LearnStatsVis: Interactive Visualizations Learning Statistics Concepts. R package version 0.1.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {LearnStatsVis: Interactive Visualizations for Learning Statistics Concepts},   author = {Zhenguo Zhang},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0}, }

title: Learn Statistics by Visualization
text: R package provides functions create sample data, perform statistical tests, generate visualizations learning statistics concepts biological examples. also includes Shiny app provides interactive interface explore concepts.

title: Learn Statistics by Visualization
text: Functions create sample data various statistical concepts Functions perform statistical tests Functions generate visualizations key statistical concepts Interactive Shiny app exploring different scenarios Biological examples throughout applications Export visualizations presentations reports

title: Learn Statistics by Visualization
text: install package:
code: # Install required packages install.packages(c("ggplot2", "dplyr", "shiny"))  # Install the LearnStatsVis package # First, install from source directory: devtools::install("path/to/Learn-statistics-by-visualization")

title: Learn Statistics by Visualization
text: package provides functions generating data creating visualizations various statistical concepts:

title: Learn Statistics by Visualization
code: # Generate data for P-value visualization pvalue_data <- generate_pvalue_data(n = 30, mean_true = 0.5, mean_null = 0, sd = 1) # Create visualization pvalue_plot <- create_pvalue_plot(pvalue_data, mean_null = 0) plot(pvalue_plot)

title: Learn Statistics by Visualization
code: # Generate data for t-test visualization ttest_data <- generate_ttest_data(n1 = 15, n2 = 15, mean1 = 0, mean2 = 0.5) # Create visualization ttest_plot <- create_ttest_plot(ttest_data) plot(ttest_plot)

title: Learn Statistics by Visualization
code: # Generate data for ANOVA visualization anova_data <- generate_anova_data(n1 = 10, n2 = 10, n3 = 10, mean1 = 0, mean2 = 0.5, mean3 = 1) # Create visualization anova_plot <- create_anova_plot(anova_data) plot(anova_plot)

title: Learn Statistics by Visualization
text: package also includes Shiny app interactive exploration concepts: Shiny app allows users : - Choose statistical concept explore - Customize parameters concept - See real-time updates visualizations based inputs - Access biological interpretations results
code: # Run the Shiny app shiny::runApp("shiny/")

title: Learn Statistics by Visualization
text: generate_pvalue_data() - Generate data P-value visualization generate_ttest_data() - Generate data t-test visualization generate_anova_data() - Generate data ANOVA visualization generate_ci_data() - Generate data confidence interval visualization generate_power_data() - Generate data power analysis generate_chisq_data() - Generate data chi-square test generate_wilcox_data() - Generate data Wilcoxon test generate_regression_data() - Generate data regression analysis

title: Learn Statistics by Visualization
text: create_pvalue_plot() - Create P-value visualization create_ttest_plot() - Create t-test visualization create_anova_plot() - Create ANOVA visualization create_ci_plot() - Create confidence interval visualization create_power_plot() - Create power analysis visualization create_chisq_plot() - Create chi-square test visualization create_wilcox_plot() - Create Wilcoxon test visualization create_regression_plot() - Create regression analysis visualization create_residuals_plot() - Create residuals plot regression

title: Learn Statistics by Visualization
text: R statistical computations visualizations ggplot2 creating high-quality charts graphs dplyr data manipulation Shiny building interactive web applications HTML/CSS front-end design JavaScript enhancing interactivity

title: Learn Statistics by Visualization
text: P values hypothesis testing T-tests ANOVA Confidence intervals Statistical power analysis Chi-square tests Wilcoxon Ranksum test Regression analysis

title: Learn Statistics by Visualization
text: can run application using Docker easier setup deployment: application accessible http://localhost:3838.
code: # Build the Docker image docker build -t learn-stats-vis .  # Run the container docker run -p 3838:3838 learn-stats-vis

text: Generate sample data ANOVA visualization

title: Generate sample data for ANOVA visualization — generate_anova_data
code: generate_anova_data(   n1 = 10,   n2 = 10,   n3 = 10,   mean1 = 0,   mean2 = 0.5,   mean3 = 1,   sd1 = 1,   sd2 = 1,   sd3 = 1,   alpha = 0.05 )

title: Generate sample data for ANOVA visualization — generate_anova_data
text: n1 Sample size group 1 n2 Sample size group 2 n3 Sample size group 3 mean1 Mean group 1 mean2 Mean group 2 mean3 Mean group 3 sd1 Standard deviation group 1 sd2 Standard deviation group 2 sd3 Standard deviation group 3 alpha Significance level

title: Generate sample data for ANOVA visualization — generate_anova_data
text: list containing sample data test statistics

text: Generate sample data chi-square test visualization

title: Generate sample data for chi-square test visualization — generate_chisq_data
code: generate_chisq_data(   observed = c(10, 15, 20, 25),   expected = NULL,   alpha = 0.05 )

title: Generate sample data for chi-square test visualization — generate_chisq_data
text: observed Observed frequencies expected Expected frequencies (optional, provided calculated) alpha Significance level

title: Generate sample data for chi-square test visualization — generate_chisq_data
text: list containing chi-square test results visualization data

title: Generate sample data for confidence interval visualization — generate_ci_data
code: generate_ci_data(   true_mean = 0,   sd = 1,   n = 30,   confidence_level = 0.95,   num_samples = 20 )

title: Generate sample data for confidence interval visualization — generate_ci_data
text: true_mean True population mean sd Population standard deviation n Sample size confidence_level Confidence level (e.g., 0.95 95 num_samplesNumber samples visualize list containing multiple confidence intervals properties   Generate sample data confidence interval visualization
